results.title: The New boys
results.brief_description: St. John’s Cathedral Boys’ School, at Selkirk, Manitoba, is the most demanding outdoor school in North America, but it cannot accommodate all the students who would like to enroll. Boys of thirteen to fifteen begin with an initiation tougher than they have ever faced: paddling canoes through some five hundred kilometers of wilderness in two weeks, portaging and camping all the way, learning not only outdoor lore but cooperation and self-confidence as well.

results.title: The New baby
results.brief_description: The daily care of a new baby; breast and bottle feeding; causes of crying between feeds; sleep and coverings; vitamins and orange juice; bathing and suitable types of clothes; the importance of care and affection at all times and of helping the other children in the family adjust to the new arrival.

results.title: The New Adventures of Pippi Longstocking (Captioned)
results.creator_credit: Columbia, Gary Mehlman, Walter Moshay and Ken Annakin
results.brief_description: Based on the classic book by Astrid Lindgren, Pippi Longstocking bursts on to the screen in this action film. Pippi is a pig-tailed, freckle-faced ball of fun and energy. Mischievous, lovable and always in trouble, Pippi is a young orphan who refuses to let anything stand in her way. Full of colourful characters, fun and laughs “The new adventures of Pippi Longstocking” is a delightful adventure movie for the young and the young at heart.

results.title: The Netsilik eskimo today
results.creator_credit: ONF | NFB, John Friedman, Francois Seguillon and Gilles Blais
results.brief_description: This film, made in 1972, shows the life of an Inuit family in the settlement of Pelly Bay inside the Arctic Circle. Under a federal government scheme, permanent heated housing, a school and a store are provided for the community. This film affords a glimpse of the Inuit adaptation to these changed conditions.

results.title: The Netherland
results.creator_credit: Bert Haanstra Film Productions and Bert Haanstra
results.brief_description: Directed by internationally known film maker Bert Haanstra, this non narrated impressionistic film looks at various facets of life and landscapes of which the Netherlands is composed. The filmmaker has also cleverly woven into the film structure, several visual deceptions making the film of value to media studies classes.

results.title: The Nervous system
results.brief_description: A study of the structure of the nervous system of the human being; the following points are given detailed treatment: the nature of a nervous impulse; the pathways and connections of the nervous system; the conditions which set up nervous impulses; their passage from cell to cell; their discharge and resultant activity; reflexes, sensory integration, and activity of the cerebrum.

results.title: The Neglected
results.brief_description: A portrayal of families whose children have come under the protection of community authorities as a result of abuse or neglect. It demonstrates that skilled techniques can change patterns of dangerous and unhealthy family relationships and help unstable human beings achieve acceptable standards of parenthood. The operation of the Child Protective Services is shown, stressing the relationship between supervisor and caseworker. It throws light on the subtle and complex aspects of poverty and shows how these characteristics contribute to the poverty cycle. Points a possible way to break this vicious cycle through the rehabilitation of families.

results.title: The Neatos and the Litterbugs in the mystery of ...
results.creator_credit: Allan Frank Sandler, Little Golden Books, Sandler Institutional Films and Zagreb Film
results.brief_description: Porky, one of the Neatos has won a prize but cannot find the claim ticket. The Neatos clean up the littered community environment in an attempt to find the ticket. Presents the concept of keeping the environment clean and free of rubbish that ultimately becomes pollution. Points out the value of taking care of the home environment before going out into the community.
